description:
This is an in-depth study of the socio-economic

development in the history of China, covering the

period from 3000B.C. to A.D. 1911. It includes critical

analysis of various economic practices, land systems

and financial administrations during the period

covered, and their implications on political, social

and cultural aspects of the country. Major economic

and financial theories will be discussed; prominent

economists and financial bureaucrats will also be

appraised in relation to the political and social

impacts of the reform policies they implemented
title: Socio-Economic History of China
